Method Name : C:\Programme\MTS Systems\TestWorks\Methods\XP\G-Series CSM Standard Hardness, Modulus, and Tip Cal.msm
Owner : MTS
Channels
	Modulus
		Internal Name : Modulus
		Units : GPa
		Formula : IF (Isvalid(DisplacementIntoSurface) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker), (1.0-pow( PoissonsRatio, 2.0))*pow ( (1/ReducedModulus-(1-pow(IndenterTipPoissonsRatio, 2.0) )/TipModulus()), -1.0), InvalidDouble())
		Description : Subject to a number of assumptions, this is the Young's modulus for the sample. 
Young's modulus relates stress and strain when the material is subjected to 
elastic deformation.  
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 5
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Contact Area
		Internal Name : ContactArea
		Units : nm^2
		Formula : TipArea(ContactDepth,_TipName)
		Description : The projected contact area between the indenter tip and the sample.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 6
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No

		Internal Name : _Time

		Formula : 
		Description : Time.

		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value

	Raw Load
		Internal Name : _Load
		Units : mN
		Formula : 
		Description : Raw force applied electromagnetically to the indenter column.
		Places : 6
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 21
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Effect of Increasing Extension
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Contact Depth
		Internal Name : ContactDepth
		Units : nm
		Formula : if (DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0 AND CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker, DisplacementIntoSurface-Epsilon*LoadOnSample/Stiffness,InvalidDouble())
		Description : The depth over which the indenter makes contact with the sample.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 7
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Harmonic Contact Stiffness
		Internal Name : Stiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 1/(1/(_HarmonicStiffness)-1/ ( _HarmonicFrame+HarmonicFrameCorrection))
		Description : Harmonic stiffness of the contact, used directly in the calculation of contact area, 
hardness, and reduced modulus.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 3
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Hardness
		Internal Name : Hardness
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker), LoadOnSample/ContactArea, InvalidDouble())
		Description : Mean pressure of the contact.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 4
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No

		Internal Name : SegmentIndex
		Units : 
		Formula : IF(CurrentIndex() eq 0, 0, SegmentIndex)
		Description : Identifies segment number (sequentially indexed).

	Frame Stiffness
		Internal Name : _Frame
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Stiffness used to account for slight deformation in the test frame that 
occurs when applying load to a sample.

	Segment Type
		Internal Name : SegmentType
		Units : 
		Formula : IF(CurrentIndex() eq 0, 0, SegmentType)
		Description : Identifies segment type (approach, load, unload, etc.) for post-test analysis.  
Set using "Segment Type" test segments.  
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 24
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : Yes
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Reduced Modulus
		Internal Name : ReducedModulus
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker),Stiffness*Sqrt(Pi())/(2*Beta*sqrt(ContactArea)),InvalidDouble())
		Description : The reduced modulus includes biaxial deformation in both the indenter
and the sample. 
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 22
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Raw Displacement
		Internal Name : _Displacement
		Units : um
		Formula : 
		Description : Absolute position of the indenter shaft relative to the center of its full range 
of travel.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 20
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Effect of Increasing Extension
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Load vs Disp Slope
		Internal Name : _ContactStiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Instantaneous and continuous slope of load with respect to displacement.  
Used for the in-situ determination of surface contact.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 18
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Effect of Increasing Extension
		Invert Polarity : No

	Harmonic Frame Stiffness
		Internal Name : _HarmonicFrame
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Stiffness used to account for the slight influence of the test frame on the
measured harmonic stiffness

	Load On Sample
		Internal Name : LoadOnSample
		Units : mN
		Formula : _Load-_Load[SurfaceMarker] -(_Displacement-_Displacement[SurfaceMarker])*_Column[SurfaceMarker]
		Description : Load on the sample, "zeroed" when the indenter first contacts the surface.  
This value has been corrected for the force imposed by the springs supporting 
the indenter shaft.
		Places : 6
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 1
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Harmonic Stiffness
		Internal Name : _HarmonicStiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Combined harmonic stiffness of the contact together with the frame.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 15
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No

		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Stiffness Squared Over Load
		Internal Name : LoadByStiffnessSquared
		Units : GPa
		Formula : if ((DisplacementIntoSurface>0.0) AND (CurrentIndex() < EndOfLoadingMarker), Stiffness*Stiffness/LoadOnSample, InvalidDouble())
		Description : Proportional to the ratio of the square of modulus to hardness.  Useful for
troubleshooting.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Scientific
		Export Order : 25
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Time On Sample
		Internal Name : TimeOnSample
		Units : s
		Formula : _Time-_Time[SurfaceMarker]
		Description : Time, "zeroed" when the indenter first contacts the surface.  
		Places : 6
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 2
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No

	Harmonic System Damping
		Internal Name : _HarmonicSystemDamping
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Contact and equipment together are modeled as a simple harmonic oscillator,
i.e. one effective spring (K), one effective dashpot (D), and one effective 
mass (m) subjected to a force, F(t), oscillating at frequency, w.  
This is the "imaginary" part of the solution for such as system; that is, Dw.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 16
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	CSM Status
		Internal Name : _CSM
		Units : 
		Formula : 
		Description : Status of lock-in amplifier. A value of 1 indicates everything is OK.
A value of 0 indicates that the analog-to-digital converter is overloaded.
		Places : 0
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 8
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Phase Angle
		Internal Name : _PhaseAngle
		Units : deg
		Formula : 
		Description : Phase angle between the applied load oscillation and the resulting 
displacement oscillation.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 19
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Effect of Increasing Extension
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Displacement Into Surface
		Internal Name : DisplacementIntoSurface
		Units : nm
		Formula : _Displacement - _Displacement[SurfaceMarker]  -DriftCorrection*(_Time - _Time[SurfaceMarker]) - ((_Load-_Load[SurfaceMarker] )/( _Frame+FrameStiffnessCorrection))
		Description : Penetration into the test surface as measured from the point at which the 
indenter first touches the sample.  This value has been corrected for thermal
drift and for any deflection in the instrument frame.  
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 0
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : No
		Save Raw Data : No
		Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
	Harmonic System Stiffness
		Internal Name : _HarmonicSystemStiffness
		Units : N/m
		Formula : 
		Description : Contact and equipment together are modeled as a simple harmonic oscillator,
i.e. one effective spring (K), one effective dashpot (D), and one effective 
mass (m) subjected to a force, F(t), oscillating at frequency, w.  
This is the "real" part of the solution for such as system; that is, K - mw^2.
		Places : 3
		Notation : Fixed
		Export Order : 17
		Effect of Increasing Extension : Increases Value
		Invert Polarity : No
		Hidden : Yes
		Save Raw Data : Yes
		Recalculate Post-Test : No
		Calculate during Test : No
		Never Recalculate : No
		Advanced button : No
		Locked : No
		Discardable : No
Inputs
	Batch Inputs
		_Memo
			Internal Name : _Memo
			Default Value :   
			Description : This input is used to hold the sample memo.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : Yes
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Approach Distance to Store
			Internal Name : _ApproachDistanceToSave
			Default Value : 1000.000  nm
			Description : Distance within the approach segment over which data is acquired and recorded.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No

			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Delta X For Finding Surface
			Internal Name : _DeltaXForFindingSurface
			Default Value : -50.000  um
			Description : Instrument uses a 'practice' indent to locate the test surface.

This is the distance in the x-direction of the practice indent from the first prescribed
indent on the sample.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Delta Y For Finding Surface
			Internal Name : _DeltaYForFindingSurface
			Default Value : -50.000  um
			Description : Instrument uses a 'practice' indent to locate the test surface.

This is the distance in the y-direction of the practice indent from the first prescribed
indent on the sample.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No

			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Distance
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachDistance
			Default Value : 1000.000  nm
			Description : The indenter begins 'looking' for the test surface at this (estimated) distance
above the surface.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Sensitivity
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachSensitivity
			Default Value : 40.000  %
			Description : This value sets the criteria that the indenter uses to decide whether it has 
contacted the test surface.  A lower value causes more sensitive surface detection, 
but increases the likelihood of false detection (and vice versa).
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Approach Velocity
			Internal Name : _SurfaceApproachVelocity
			Default Value : 10.000  nm/s
			Description : Speed with which the indenter approaches the test surface.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Surface Stiffness
			Internal Name : SurfaceStiffness
			Default Value : 160.000  N/m
			Description : Used to establish the point of contact for the purpose of preliminary calculations 
only.  
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No

			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A

		X Y Table Speed
			Internal Name : XYTableSpeed
			Default Value : 1.000  mm/s
			Description : Velocity of stages.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Y Test Position
			Internal Name : _YLocation
			Default Value : ****  um
			Description : The y coordinate of the desired test position.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
	Internal Use
		Added Approach First Dent
			Internal Name : AddedApproachFirstDent
			Default Value : 7000.000  nm
			Description : This is not the actual approach distance added to the first indent.  
This is an approximation used to calculate an appropriate maximum loading time
based on the approach distance and approach velocity specified by the user.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A

			Default Value : Jennifer Hay

			Number of Readings : 1

			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No

	Hold Segment Inputs
		Drift Determination Time
			Internal Name : DriftDeterminationTime
			Default Value : 50.000  s
			Description : Time over which the force on the indenter is held at a small, constant value.  
Data acquired during this time are used to determine thermal drift.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Peak Hold Time
			Internal Name : PeakHoldTime
			Default Value : 10.000  s
			Description : Time over which load is held constant immediately before each unload.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed

	Oliver & Pharr Constants
		Beta
			Internal Name : Beta
			Default Value : 1.000  
			Description : Factor which allows one to apply the axisymmetric Sneddon contact solution to 
indentation with pyramids.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : 1.000
			Maximum : 1.034
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : Yes
			Input Order : N/A
		Epsilon
			Internal Name : Epsilon
			Default Value : 0.750  
			Description : Geometric factor used in the calculation of contact depth.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : 0.720
			Maximum : 0.750
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : Yes

			Locked : No
			Result : No

			Only Allow Choice : No

	Reported Test Inputs
		Allowable Drift Rate
			Internal Name : _AllowableDriftRate
			Default Value : 0.050  nm/s
			Description : Thermal stability criteria for initiating tests on a sample.   While the indenter is in 
contact with the test surface under a small constant force, the time rate of
change in the displacement must be less than this value.  The lower the value, the
longer the instrument will wait before initiating testing on a sample. 
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Depth Limit
			Internal Name : DepthLimit
			Default Value : 2000.000  nm
			Description : Maximum penetration of the indenter into the test surface.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A

			Default Value : 45.000  Hz
			Description : Target (set point) for harmonic frequency.

			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No

			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No

			Internal Name : HarmonicDisplacement
			Default Value : 2.000  nm
			Description : Target (set point) for amplitude of displacement oscillation.

			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1

			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Strain Rate Target
			Internal Name : StrainRate
			Default Value : 0.050  1/s
			Description : Loading is controlled such that the loading rate divided by the load on the test 
surface is held constant at this value.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No

			Locked : No

			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
	Reported Calculation Inputs
		Frame Stiffness Correction
			Internal Name : FrameStiffnessCorrection
			Default Value : 0.000  N/m
			Description : Correction applied to the Frame Stiffness.  This correction is added directly
to the Frame Stiffness (i.e. compliances are NOT summed).  Correction might
be needed if the sample is mounted in such a way that affects the 
frame stiffness.

			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Harmonic Frame Stiffness Correction
			Internal Name : HarmonicFrameCorrection
			Default Value : 0.000  N/m
			Description : Correction applied to the Harmonic Frame Stiffness.  This correction is added
directly to the Harmonic Frame Stiffness (i.e. compliances are NOT summed). 
Correction might be needed if the sample is mounted in such a way that affects
the frame stiffness.

			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Maximum Calculation Depth
			Internal Name : Max_Modulus_Depth
			Default Value : 200.000  nm
			Description : Only data acquired at surface penetrations less than this value are used in 
the calculation of average hardness and modulus.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : 0.000
			Maximum : 0.000
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Minimum Calculation Depth
			Internal Name : Min_Modulus_Depth
			Default Value : 100.000  nm
			Description : Only data acquired at surface penetrations greater than this value are used 
in the calculation of average hardness and modulus.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Percent Unload In Stiffness Calculation
			Internal Name : PercentUnloadInStiffnessCalc
			Default Value : 50.000  %
			Description : Percent of unloading curve used in the calculation of stiffness from unload.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Perform Drift Correction
			Internal Name : PerformDriftCorrection
			Default Value : 1  
			Description : Flag that determines whether the displacement data are corrected for 
thermal expansion/contraction of the test material and/or equipment. 
 A value of unity means that the correction will be performed.  Note: this
input should be set to zero when testing polymers or metals that creep.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 0
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : Yes
			Input Order : N/A
		Poissons Ratio
			Internal Name : PoissonsRatio
			Default Value : 0.180  
			Description : Poisson ratio for the test sample.  Default value is for fused silica (amorphous
quartz).  Although this value is used in the calculation of modulus, the result is
rather insensitive.  Use the following guidelines: 0.2 for glasses and ceramics; 
0.25 for steels; 0.3 for polymers and soft metals.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : Yes
			Input Required : Yes
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : Yes
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
	Plot Scaling Inputs
		Max Plotted Hardness
			Internal Name : MaxPlottedHardness
			Default Value : 30.000  GPa
			Description : Maximum axis value on Hardness plot.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Post-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Max Plotted Modulus
			Internal Name : MaxPlottedModulus
			Default Value : 300.000  GPa
			Description : Maximum axis value on Modulus plot.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Pre-Test
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No
			Display Only : No
			Editable Post-Test : No
			Input Required : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Min Plotted Hardness
			Internal Name : MinPlottedHardness
			Default Value : 0.000  GPa
			Description : Minimum axis value on Hardness plot.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Post-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No
			Places : 3
			Notation : Fixed
			Hidden : No

			Reporting Order : N/A
			Panel Input : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Choice List : No
			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
		Min Plotted Modulus
			Internal Name : MinPlottedModulus
			Default Value : 0.000  GPa
			Description : Minimum axis value on Modulus plot.
			Source : Keyboard Only
			Statistics Type : None
			Number of Readings : 1
			When : Post-Sample
			Minimum : No
			Maximum : No

			Only Allow Choice : No
			Input Order : N/A
Formulas
	Batch Formulas
		Average SS by P
			Internal Name : AveragePbySS
			Units : GPa
			Formula : AverageValue (LoadByStiffnessSquared,Index_of_Min_Calc_Depth, Index_of_Max_Calc_Range)
			Description : Average "Stiffness Squared Over Load" over a specified range of penetration 
depths.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Batch Name
			Internal Name : _BatchName
			Units : 
			Formula : concat(CurrentDate("yyyy-MM-dd")," Batch #")
			Description : Creates the name of the batch.

TestWorks stores the information for a batch in a directory.  The directory
contains the batch file, sample files, and other information stored about the batch.

			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		E Average Over Defined Range
			Internal Name : E_Over_Depth_Range
			Units : GPa
			Formula : AverageValue (Modulus,Index_of_Min_Calc_Depth, Index_of_Max_Calc_Range)
			Description : Average modulus calculated from harmonic data over a specified range of 
penetration depths.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 0
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		H Average Over Defined Range
			Internal Name : HAverageOverDefinedRange
			Units : GPa
			Formula : AverageValue (Hardness,Index_of_Min_Calc_Depth, Index_of_Max_Calc_Range)
			Description : Average hardness calculated from harmonic data over a specified range of 
penetration depths.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 1
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Max Approach Time
			Internal Name : MaxApproachTime
			Units : s
			Formula : (AddedApproachFirstDent+_SurfaceApproachDistance)/_SurfaceApproachVelocity
			Description : Time allotted for the approach segment.  During a particular
test, if the time required for the approach exceeds this value, 
the test terminates and the instrument moves on to the next test.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Sample
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Max Calc Range Marker
			Internal Name : Index_of_Max_Calc_Range
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (DisplacementIntoSurface,Max_Modulus_Depth, SurfaceMarker)
			Description : Index for the last data point to be included in the calculation of average
hardness and modulus.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : N
			Color : Green
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Min Calc Range Marker
			Internal Name : Index_of_Min_Calc_Depth
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (DisplacementIntoSurface,Min_Modulus_Depth, SurfaceMarker)
			Description : Index for the first data point to be included in the calculation of average
hardness and modulus.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : M
			Color : Green
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Test File Name For Export
			Internal Name : _ExportFileName
			Units : 
			Formula : IF((NumberOfSpecimens (1)+1) GT 99, Concat("Test",IToA((NumberOfSpecimens (1)+1) ) ), IF((NumberOfSpecimens (1)+1) GT 9, Concat("Test0",IToA((NumberOfSpecimens (1)+1) ) ),Concat("Test00",IToA(NumberOfSpecimens (1)+1 ) )))
			Description : Filename to be used when the test is exported.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Time At Start Of Approach
			Internal Name : TimeAtStartOfApproach
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentTime()
			Description : Clock reading off the PC, recorded just before starting the approach.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 3
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Total Indent Time
			Internal Name : TotalIndentTime
			Units : s
			Formula : _Time[EndDriftMarker]-_Time[SurfaceMarker]
			Description : Time from when the indenter first contacts the surface to the end of the hold 
for thermal drift.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 1
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
	Approach Formulas
		Surface Stiffness Increase
			Internal Name : SurfaceStiffnessIncrease
			Units : N/m
			Formula : 500.0*NewtonsPerMeter*_SurfaceApproachSensitivity
			Description : In situ, surface contact is determined to be the point at which the change in 
load with respect to displacement reaches this value.  When this criteria is met,
the approach is terminated and the prescribed loading algorithm begins.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
	Load Segment Formulas
		Prescribed Loading Rate
			Internal Name : LoadingRateForStrain
			Units : mN/s
			Formula : LoadOnSample*StrainRate + _SurfaceApproachVelocity * _Column
			Description : Prescribed loading rate based on the prescribed strain rate and current load on the
sample.  Continuously recalculated.  
			Default Value : 
			When : Every Point
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 6
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
	UnLoad Segment Formulas
		Unload Limit
			Internal Name : UnloadLimit
			Units : uN
			Formula : LoadOnSample * (1.0-PercentToUnload)
			Description : Load at which to stop the unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Unload Rate
			Internal Name : UnloadRate
			Units : uN/s
			Formula : IF (LoadOnSample*StrainRate>UnloadRate, LoadOnSample*StrainRate, UnloadRate)
			Description : Rate at which the indenter is withdrawn from the sample.

			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
	Hold Segment Formulas
		Drift Correction
			Internal Name : DriftCorrection
			Units : nm/s
			Formula : PerformDriftCorrection*SlopeValue (_Displacement,_Time, DriftDeterminationMarker, EndDriftMarker)
			Description : Displacement rate due to thermal expansion/contraction of the test material.  

			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 2
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
	Segment Markers
		End Drift Marker
			Internal Name : EndDriftMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for last data point to be used in the calculation of thermal drift.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : Yes
			Symbol : E
			Color : Magenta
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		End Of Loading Marker
			Internal Name : EndOfLoadingMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the last data point in the loading segment.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : L
			Color : Blue
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No

			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Start Drift Marker
			Internal Name : DriftDeterminationMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for first data point to be used in the calculation of thermal drift.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : Yes
			Symbol : D
			Color : Magenta
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Start Hold Marker
			Internal Name : StartHoldMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to the start of the hold for thermal drift. 
Used in the calculation of stiffness from unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : H
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Surface Marker
			Internal Name : SurfaceMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : ChannelIndex (_HarmonicStiffness, SurfaceStiffness)
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to surface contact.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : Yes
			Symbol : S
			Color : DarkBlue
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : No
			Never Recalculate : Yes
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Unloading Stiffness Marker
			Internal Name : UnloadStiffnessMarker
			Units : 
			Formula : CurrentIndex()
			Description : Index for the data point corresponding to the start of unload.
			Default Value : 
			When : In Test Segment
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : Yes
			Moveable Marker : Yes

	Oliver & Pharr Calculations
		Area Coefficient 1

			Formula : TipParameter(1)
			Description : The nth coefficient in the area function.
			Default Value :

			Moveable Marker : No

		Area Coefficient 9
			Internal Name : AreaCoefficient9
			Units : 
			Formula : TipParameter(9)
			Description : The nth coefficient in the area function.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Scientific
			Places : 9
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Contact Area From Unload
			Internal Name : UnloadingContactArea
			Units : nm^2
			Formula : TipArea(UnloadingContactDepth,_TipName)
			Description : Contact area calculated using the elastic contact stiffness as determined from the 
slope of the unloading curve.

This is the projected contact area between the indenter tip and the sample.


			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Contact Depth From Unload
			Internal Name : UnloadingContactDepth
			Units : nm
			Formula : DisplacementIntoSurface[UnloadStiffnessMarker]-0.75*LoadOnSample[UnloadStiffnessMarker]/UnloadingStiffness
			Description : Contact depth calculated using the elastic contact stiffness as determined from the 
slope of the unloading curve.

Contact depth is the depth over which the indenter makes contact with the 
sample.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Hardness From Unload
			Internal Name : HardnessFromUnload
			Units : GPa
			Formula : LoadOnSample[UnloadStiffnessMarker]/UnloadingContactArea
			Description : Mean pressure of the contact calculated using the elastic contact stiffness
as measured from the slope of the unloading curve.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Modulus From Unload
			Internal Name : ModulusFromUnload
			Units : GPa
			Formula : IF(Isvalid(UnloadingStiffness), (1.0-pow( PoissonsRatio, 2.0))*pow ( (1/ReducedModulusFromUnload-(1-pow(IndenterTipPoissonsRatio, 2.0) )/TipModulus()), -1.0), InvalidDouble())
			Description : Modulus calculated using the elastic contact stiffness as measured from the 
slope of the unloading curve.

Subject to a number of assumptions, this is the Young's modulus for the sample.  
Young's modulus relates stress and strain when the material is subjected to 
elastic deformation.  
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : No
		Reduced Modulus From Unload
			Internal Name : ReducedModulusFromUnload
			Units : GPa
			Formula : Sqrt(Pi())*UnloadingStiffness/(2*Beta*Sqrt(UnloadingContactArea))
			Description : Reduced modulus calculated using the elastic contact stiffness as determined by
the slope of the unloading curve.

The reduced modulus includes biaxial deformation in both the indenter
and the test sample. 
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : Yes
			Advanced button : Yes
		Stiffness From Unload
			Internal Name : UnloadingStiffness
			Units : N/m
			Formula : UnloadingStiffnessValue(DisplacementIntoSurface , LoadOnSample,UnloadStiffnessMarker +5,UnloadStiffnessMarker+Floor(PercentUnloadInStiffnessCalc*(StartHoldMarker-UnloadStiffnessMarker)))
			Description : Elastic contact stiffness as determined from the slope of the unloading curve.
			Default Value : 
			When : Post-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 3
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : No
			Reporting Order : N/A
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : No
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
		Tip Name
			Internal Name : _TipName
			Units : 
			Formula : TipName()
			Description : References a specific area function.  The area function is an empirical 
polynomial that relates the distance from the apex of the indenter tip to 
cross-sectional area, i.e. A = f(d).  Every real indenter has a unique area function.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
			Hidden : No
			Locked : No
			Result : Yes
			Reporting Order : 4
			Recalculate Post-Test : Yes
			Never Recalculate : No
			Sample Level : Yes
			Reset To Default Values : No
			Advanced button : Yes
	Data Acquisition Formulas
		Approach Points To Save
			Internal Name : ApproachPointsToSave
			Units : 
			Formula : _ApproachDistanceToSave/_SurfaceApproachVelocity * DataRate
			Description : The number of approach points to save.
			Default Value : 
			When : Pre-Test
			Notation : Fixed
			Places : 0
			Marker : No
			Moveable Marker : No
			Symbol : 
			Color : White
